definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Seek advice at the same time appoint commissarial number will be flexibility, without limitation of rigid quota of people.
sentences.chinese: 同時諮詢委委員人數將是彈性的，無硬性名額限制。

sentences.english: No hard rule dictates how long a line of code should be.
sentences.chinese: 沒有硬性規定一個代碼行應該多長。

sentences.english: Monitor hard bounces and ensure you obtain complaint feedback from your ISP.
sentences.chinese: 監管硬性彈出廣告，確保從ISP處收到投訴反饋。

sentences.english: Attendance at evening prayers is not compulsory .
sentences.chinese: 參加晚禱並非硬性規定。

sentences.english: We are committed to no rigid formula.
sentences.chinese: 我們未必矢志堅持任何硬性方案。

sentences.english: It was then made compulsory for doctors from over-seas to sit by Nellie for a month.
sentences.chinese: 那時硬性規定國外來的醫生都要見習一個月。

sentences.english: Rigid means inflexible or very strict.
sentences.chinese: 硬性指不靈活或非常嚴格。

sentences.english: Originally, they were very rigid about this.
sentences.chinese: 起初，規定是硬性嚴格的。

sentences.english: It's a trip aimed at increasing anti-narcotics cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 此行的目的在於加強反硬性非法毒品的合作。

sentences.english: They tried to hammer the rules into my head.
sentences.chinese: 他們企圖把那些規則硬性灌輸進我的大腦。

sentences.english: Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into cake mixture.
sentences.chinese: 將蛋清攪打至硬性發泡，混入蛋糕料中。

sentences.english: Sometimes, the soft and hard incentives line up.
sentences.chinese: 有時，軟性和硬性獎勵會排隊。

sentences.english: The dollar should be backed by gold and silver, so we have hard money.
sentences.chinese: 美元應當由金銀來做後盾，所以我們要有硬性貨幣。

sentences.english: Belong to you ask that kind of people, no hard and fast rules.
sentences.chinese: 屬於你所要求的那一類人，無需硬性規定。

sentences.english: Add the warm gelatine mixture into the cream and beat until the stiff peak forms.
sentences.chinese: 將吉利液加入，然後攪打至乾硬性發泡。

definition: to give a more granular level of detail/to elaborate/to refine/to become more differentiated
to consider/to give serious consideration to sth/consideration
